definition:
Let $V$ be a vector space over a field. Let $S_n$ be the symmetric group
on $\{1, \ldots, n\}$. An order-n $A \in V^{\otimes n}$ is said to be **
if $P(\sigma)A = A$ for all $\sigma \in S_n$, where $P(\sigma)$ is the
permutation operator associated to $\sigma$. The set of symmetric
tensors in $V^{\otimes n}$ is denoted by $S^n(V)$.
